717414f-b.title: Manhattan: Broadway - 36th Street
717414f-b.text:
(1)
Broadway, east side, south from 36th Street. In the foreground
may be seen the nearly-completed Herald Square Building, for the
construction of which the old Seventy-First Regiment Armory has
been cut in half.
Auguust 18, 1929.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(2)
The same, seven months later. The Herald Square Building is
now cowpleted. The flags are at half-staff because of the recent
death of Chief Justice and former President William Howard Taft.
Mr. Taft was succeeded by Charles Evans Hughes as Chief Justice.
March 10, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPPODUCTIONS.
(3)
The Herald Square Building site before erection.
February 3, 1929.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

717420f.title: Manhattan: Broadway - 36th Street
717420f.text:
Broadway at the N.E. corner of 36th Street. The corner build-
ing will be demolished for the erection of the Greenwich Savings
Bank.
Late 1921.
John Wallace Gillies.
Cift of York \& Sawyer.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.

717425f-a.title: Manhattan: Broadway - 36th Street
717425f-a.text:
Broadway, east side, north from 36th Street.
February 5, 1929.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

1509103-a.folder: Broadway - 36th Street, east side, Manhattan, NY

717413f.title: Manhattan: Broadway - 36th Street (West)
717413f.text:
Broadwav, north from W. 36th Streetg 37th Street is the
intersecti i seen thru the wagon at the left. In the center,
on that side of Broadwav prominently apoears the Metropolitan
Opera House. Note the absence of Ehe Times Butlding in this view.
About 1900.
S.Y.P.L. Theatre Collection
MAY BE REPRODUCED.

717421f-a.title: Manhattan: Broadway - 36th Street
717421f-a.text:
Broadway, at and adjoining the N.E. corner of 36th Street, also
showing the north side of 36th Street looking east from Broadway.
The corner building will be torn down to make way for the Greenwich
Savings Bank.
Late 1921.
John Wallace Gillies.
Gift of York \& Sawyer.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.

1507755-a.title: 36th Street (West) - Broadway - Sixth Avenue, north side
1507755-a.folder: 36th Street (West) - Broadway - Sixth Avenue, north side, Manhattan, NY

717424f.title: Manhattan: Broadway - 36th Street
717424f.text:
Broadway, at and adjoining the N.E. corner of 36th Street. The
corner building will be demolished to build the Greenwich Savings
Bank.
Late 1921.
John Wallace Gillies.
Gift of York \& Sawyer.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.

717415f-c.title: Manhattan: Broadway - 36th Street
717415f-c.text:
Broadway, east side, from 39th to 36th Streets. The clearing
in the foreground is on the site of the Casino and Khickerbocker
theatres. Below the clearing is the Lefcourt-Normandie Building,
on the site of the old Normandie Hotel.
May 10, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
The same, to 37th Street. I the foreground is the Lefcourt-
Manhattan Building, a part of which is shown in No. 1 of this group.
May 10, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

717417f.title: Manhattan: Broadway - 36th Street
717417f.text:
Broadway, west side, from 36th to 37th Streets, with the
Marlborough Hotel in the foreground. By 1925 thus hotel will
be replaced by the twanty-story Lefcourt-Marlborough Building.
About 1922.
Aurts Brothers.
Gift of E.M. Jenks.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.

717419f.title: Manhattan: Broadway - 36th Street (West)
717419f.text:
Broadway, east side, at W. 3oth Street, showing the N. E.
and S. E. corners. The Greenwich Savings Bank is about to rise
on the first mentioned site. Fifteen years from this date will
see the lofty Herald Square building on the remaining corner.
Late 1921
John Wallace Gillies
9'8-g York and sawyer
c REPPODUCED

717423f.title: Manhattan: Broadway - 36th Street
717423f.text:
Broadway at the N.E. corner of 36th Street, showing also the
north side of 36th Street looking east from Broadway. The corner
building will soon give way to the Greenwich Savings Bank.
Late 1921.
John Wallace Gillies.
Gift of York \& Sawyer.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.

717422f.text:
Broadway at the N.E. corner of 36th Street, showing also the

717418f-a.title: Manhattan: Broadway - 36th Street
717418f-a.text:
The Sheridan Building, 1354-1362 Broadway, adjoining the N.E.
corner of 36th Street. This and the corner building will soon
be demolished for the Greenwich Savings Bank Building.
1922.
Gift of E.H. Jenks.
M.AY BE REPRODUCED.
